pageContext.description: Sides hammer up in 2 places to form very low flanges; no ornament on sides.  Faces taper from line above centre.  Edge fairly sharp, slightly chipped: marked second ridge.
pageContext.patina: Brown, rubbed, [...] areas show overall punched decoration down faces; no design, but lines [...] [...] near [...] edge on face drawn.
pageContext.surface: pitted & worn, but general preservation & outline of implement is good.
pageContext.associations: Said to have been found, 'with a lot more", including a cast-flanged axe, a winged (Irish) Palstave, & a small ribbed (Irish) spearhead in the same collection. Irish type
pageContext.publications: L.F. Chitty, Trans. Woolhope NFC., xxxii, ii (1947), xlv-xlix, Photo
pageContext.collection: Private, R. Abel Smith, Esq., Netherwood Manor, Tenbury Wells, Worcs., Given to him by an ironmonger & antiques dealer in Tenbury, Worcs., who said he bought them from the late Mr. Childe-Freeman (died 1943) & he understood they came from Netherwood as stated.
pageContext.site: stated to have been found in herefordshire, n.e. (near worcs. border) p. thornbury, netherwood manor (old house) in digging foundation for a pigsty c. 1921.
pageContext.remarks: (?) Possibly escapes from the Museum Collection of St. Michael's Choir School, Tenbury, thrown away in 1937, which included an Irish halberd.  Lily F. Chitty 18th March 1947
